commentary: Woakes to Dickwella, no run whoosh, good first nut! Woakes cuts Dickwella in half as it shapes in past the inside edge, lucky not to get any bat on it

text: shortish on the hips and tucked towards midwicket

commentary: Woakes to Dickwella, FOUR runs full outside off, taking the pace off but Dickwella rapidly cranks the speed gun back up with a full-blooded mow through the covers for four!
text: full outside off, taking the pace off but Dickwella rapidly cranks the speed gun back up with a full-blooded mow through the covers for four!

text: back of a length, 85mph and zipping through as Dickwella pulls at it and fails to connect

commentary: Curran to Dickwella, OUT gottim - chipped to mid-off running back! Out the back of the hand, Dickwella foxed as he goes up and over, doesn't manage to clear Woakes on the turn, though it's taken at the second attempt. England have their breakthrough, after an impish little knock from Dickwella

commentary: Rashid to Samarawickrama, OUT oh dear... he's top-edged a full toss to square leg! Village all round, a dipping full toss from Rashid but Samarawickrama has only succeeded in flubbing it to the man on the edge of the ring, a good catch from Woakes with the ball dropping over his shoulder. Not a bad innings from Samarawickrama but he had got rather stuck

Nearly, but not quite!

commentary: Woakes to Dananjaya, no run beaten past the outside edge, good pace and it nibbles away as the batsman props forward
text: beaten past the outside edge, good pace and it nibbles away as the batsman props forward

commentary: Woakes to Dananjaya, FOUR runs nicely played, ramped over the keeper for four! Woakes opts for the short ball and Dananjaya happily accepts the invite to sit back and up-periscope a boundary
text: nicely played, ramped over the keeper for four! Woakes opts for the short ball and Dananjaya happily accepts the invite to sit back and up-periscope a boundary

commentary: Woakes to Dananjaya, 1 run, OUT full toss outside off, sliced through backward point... and he's going to be in trouble trying to come back for two! Dananjaya is run out but a yard or two, good arm from Bairstow, SL lose their seventh wicket
text: full toss outside off, sliced through backward point... and he's going to be in trouble trying to come back for two! Dananjaya is run out but a yard or two, good arm from Bairstow, SL lose their seventh wicket

commentary: Woakes to Malinga, 1 run pitched up ad Malinga backs away, drills one down the ground to long-on, and he'll keep the strike for the final over
text: pitched up ad Malinga backs away, drills one down the ground to long-on, and he'll keep the strike for the final over

commentary: Curran to Malinga, 1 run full outside off, swatted down the ground for one
text: full outside off, swatted down the ground for one

commentary: Curran to Chandimal, 2 runs full toss, 137kph/85mph and Chandimal splices it up into the air, bounces well short of long-on running in and they hustle back for two
text: full toss, 137kph/85mph and Chandimal splices it up into the air, bounces well short of long-on running in and they hustle back for two

commentary: Curran to Chandimal, no run full and straight, pace on and Chandimal can't get under it, fielded in his follow through
text: full and straight, pace on and Chandimal can't get under it, fielded in his follow through

commentary: Curran to Chandimal, OUT gone, scooped awkwardly to short fine leg! Chandimal picks himself up, dusts himself off and walks from the field, the latest to be done by Curran's slower ball. A slightly bedraggled knock, on a very bedraggled day, but Sri Lanka do at least have a chance
text: gone, scooped awkwardly to short fine leg! Chandimal picks himself up, dusts himself off and walks from the field, the latest to be done by Curran's slower ball. A slightly bedraggled knock, on a very bedraggled day, but Sri Lanka do at least have a chance

commentary: Curran to Aponso, no run slower ball outside off, swing and a miss
text: slower ball outside off, swing and a miss

commentary: Curran to Aponso, OUT finishes with a back-of-the-hand slowie, another unsuccessful swipe from Aponso... Buttler misses with an underarm at the stumps, as Malinga charges down, but Curran grabs it and hits at the non-striker's end to effect the run-out! Excellent final over from Curran, just three runs conceded
text: finishes with a back-of-the-hand slowie, another unsuccessful swipe from Aponso... Buttler misses with an underarm at the stumps, as Malinga charges down, but Curran grabs it and hits at the non-striker's end to effect the run-out! Excellent final over from Curran, just three runs conceded

commentary: Malinga to Roy, 1 wide an absolute pie first-up! Maliinga barely hits the cut strip, way down the leg side, and Dickwella the keeper has jarred himself, flinging himself to intercept
text: an absolute pie first-up! Maliinga barely hits the cut strip, way down the leg side, and Dickwella the keeper has jarred himself, flinging himself to intercept

commentary: Malinga to Roy, no run much better from Malinga, full, straight with a hint of swing away from the right-hander. Roy plays with a straight bat
text: much better from Malinga, full, straight with a hint of swing away from the right-hander. Roy plays with a straight bat

commentary: Malinga to Roy, 1 wide leg-sided once more, not by much, but Roy lets it slide harmlessly past his pads
text: leg-sided once more, not by much, but Roy lets it slide harmlessly past his pads

commentary: Malinga to Roy, SIX runs dismissive! Nothing more than a bit of room and a lot of bottom hand, flick-boshed up and over the leg side, and all the way into the crowd!
text: dismissive! Nothing more than a bit of room and a lot of bottom hand, flick-boshed up and over the leg side, and all the way into the crowd!

commentary: Malinga to Roy, 2 runs so close in the covers! Squared up on the back foot, finding a fat leading edge, and bissecting the men on the off side, an ambitious dive but can't get close!
text: so close in the covers! Squared up on the back foot, finding a fat leading edge, and bissecting the men on the off side, an ambitious dive but can't get close!

commentary: Malinga to Roy, 2 runs up on the toes, clipped to the leg side, and Bairstow's sharp running prompts an easy second
text: up on the toes, clipped to the leg side, and Bairstow's sharp running prompts an easy second

commentary: Malinga to Roy, 1 run line and length, pressed into the covers for another single
text: line and length, pressed into the covers for another single

commentary: Malinga to Bairstow, FOUR runs on the pads, nudged with insouciance clean through square leg! Nothing more than a tap into the gap, and the greasy outfield does the rest!
text: on the pads, nudged with insouciance clean through square leg! Nothing more than a tap into the gap, and the greasy outfield does the rest!

commentary: Aponso to Roy, 1 run Roy advances, meets the pitch, clips to the on side
text: Roy advances, meets the pitch, clips to the on side

commentary: Aponso to Bairstow, OUT spanked to mid-off! A bonus wicket for Sri Lanka, Aponso was in the attack to target Roy's perceived frailty, but instead it's YJB with a loose wristy dink into Perera's bread-basket!
text: spanked to mid-off! A bonus wicket for Sri Lanka, Aponso was in the attack to target Roy's perceived frailty, but instead it's YJB with a loose wristy dink into Perera's bread-basket!

text: pressed hard into the covers

text: high elbow, working the length ball to midwicket

text: full face of the bat, tapped back to the bowler

commentary: Aponso to Root, 1 run easing into the covers with an open face, fine fielding to cut off the extra run
text: easing into the covers with an open face, fine fielding to cut off the extra run

text: turning down the leg side, tucked hard to midwicket and a slight misfield doesn't tempt the run

commentary: Dananjaya to Root, 2 runs advancing with intent, using the feet to ease a clip to deep midwicket
text: advancing with intent, using the feet to ease a clip to deep midwicket

commentary: Dananjaya to Root, FOUR runs legspinner, back of a length, pumped through the covers off the back foot. Root wasn't going to miss out there
text: legspinner, back of a length, pumped through the covers off the back foot. Root wasn't going to miss out there

text: tucked to the on-side, well judged single

commentary: Aponso to Roy, no run advancing for the single after a tuck to leg. Sent back
text: advancing for the single after a tuck to leg. Sent back

commentary: Aponso to Roy, 2 runs a flat-footed thump down the ground, a sprawling dive at long-on from Dasun Shanaka. Good commitment
text: a flat-footed thump down the ground, a sprawling dive at long-on from Dasun Shanaka. Good commitment

commentary: Aponso to Root, OUT bowled him! Root is suckered by the slider! Perhaps got too loose with the front-foot push, it would have been lbw had it not cannoned into the middle stump. England are two-down and making harder work of this than their run-rate implies...
text: bowled him! Root is suckered by the slider! Perhaps got too loose with the front-foot push, it would have been lbw had it not cannoned into the middle stump. England are two-down and making harder work of this than their run-rate implies...

commentary: Malinga to Roy, FOUR runs pongo-ed over the covers! Roy examines the toe of his bat, as well he might, as he had to reach that on a stepladder. A slower ball, wide of off stump, but raw power drills it past the sprawling deep cover!

commentary: Dananjaya to Roy, OUT huge appeal, but there's no bat on that sweep as the ball slides down the leg side... but hang on, there's a review for lbw... seems optimistic! But hang on for a second time, it hit the back leg ... and it is hitting the leg stump! Fair play Dickwella, he was adamant!

commentary: de Silva to Stokes, no run pounded back to the bowler, and he can't take the rebound! Nathan Lyon would have swallowed that, but this one burst through his hands, into his collar-bone, and looped up tantalisingly... but he had completely lost sight of it as the ball plopped to the deck.
